intro: Hornstedtia costata, commonly known as the crested hornstedtia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its distinctive, ridged or crested appearance. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in sunny, arid environments. Its leaves are finely divided and fern-like, while its small, white or pale yellow flowers appear in umbrella-like clusters. Hornstedtia costata is often found in California and is considered a rare and endangered species due to habitat loss.
